meanings.definition: A title for an abbot or abbess.
meanings.sent1: The abbes led the daily prayers at the monastery.
meanings.sent2: The abbes were respected members of the religious community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to dress up as an abbes for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and wisdom made her the abbes of the village, guiding everyone with gentle words.
meanings.sent5: The golden cross around his neck marked him as the abbes of the sacred place.

meanings.sent1: We visited the old abbey and saw many abbes walking around.
meanings.sent2: The abbes gathered for their annual meeting to discuss community matters.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be abbes, wearing makeshift robes and chanting in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with colorful flowers, resembling a sea of abbes in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The marketplace buzzed with activity as the abbes sold their handmade crafts.
